title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1.1: STRENGHTENED CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2025, key child protection actors have increased capacity to strengthen an appropriate child protection and well-beingsystem (national)., which contributes to Evaluation, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid), Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, girls, boys, and adolescents in CÃ´te d'Ivoire benefit from a legal identity and are protected from violence, exploitation, negligence, and harmful practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, key child protection actors have increased capacity to strengthen an appropriate child protection and well-beingsystem(national).

description.narrative: In 2021 the CO supported the development of a common, coordinated vision for child protection, together with line ministries and development partners. A national policy for protecting children and women was drafted, in line with INSPIRE strategies and as a contribution to Côte d’Ivoire’s status as a Pathfinder country in the global end-violence initiative. A national statistics report on child protection data was published by the Ministry of Family, Women and Children (MFFE), and evidence-building around child protection continued through dissemination of the violence against children (VAC) survey results to social services personnel and academia. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
